pass_1.paper_name: Radiation Effects Predicted, Observed, and Compared for Spacecraft Systems
pass_1.objective: The main objective of the paper is to document radiation effects observed in selected spacecraft at the system and subsystem levels, relate them to predicted radiation effects in parts, and provide guidance in designs of future spacecraft electronics to improve tolerance to various radiation effects.

parts.other_details: Contains many SEE-sensitive parts; no destructive latchup observed after more than four cumulative years on orbit.

pass_1.paper_name: SEE In-Flight Data for Two Static 32KB Memories on High Earth Orbit
pass_1.objective: The main objective of the paper is to present SEE in-flight measurements for two 32KB SRAMs in the MPTB orbit, analyzing the major contributions to event rates from proton radiation belts and the effects of solar events on stuck bits and SEU rates.

parts.other_details: Entirely tested using Ram Static Test (RST) method. Exhibits stuck bits phenomena during solar events.

preliminary_test_data.environmental_conditions: High Earth Orbit, exposure to proton radiation belts and solar events

seeData.energy_levels: Proton threshold: 10 MeV, Heavy Ion threshold: 1.7 MeV/mg.cm²
seeData.environmental_conditions: High Earth Orbit, exposure to proton radiation belts and solar events
seeData.special_notes: The major contribution to the SEU rates comes from the proton radiation belts. Stuck bits correlated to solar events indicating heavy ions presence.

parts.other_details: Partly tested using both Cyclic Redundancy Checksum (CRC) and Ram Static Test (RST) methods. Used for storage of T225 process workspaces and data.

preliminary_test_data.environmental_conditions: High Earth Orbit, exposure to proton radiation belts and solar events

seeData.energy_levels: Proton threshold: 5 MeV, Heavy Ion threshold: 0.1 MeV/mg.cm²
seeData.environmental_conditions: High Earth Orbit, exposure to proton radiation belts and solar events
seeData.special_notes: The device is more sensitive to protons and heavy ions compared to the HM62256. The SEU rate is significantly influenced by solar events.

pass_2.paper_name: SEE In-Flight Data for Two Static 32KB Memories on High Earth Orbit
pass_2.objective: The main objective of the paper is to present the detailed analysis of in-flight data obtained for two 32KB SRAMs in the MPTB orbit, focusing on the performance, reliability, and survivability of these devices in the space radiation environment over a four-year period.

parts.other_details: Entirely tested using Ram Static Test (RST) method. Exhibited stuck bits during solar events.

preliminary_test_data.environmental_conditions: High Earth Orbit, exposure to proton radiation belts and solar events

seeData.environmental_conditions: High Earth Orbit, exposure to proton radiation belts and solar events
seeData.special_notes: Stuck bits observed during solar events, indicating presence of heavy ions.

parts.other_details: Partly tested using both Cyclic Redundancy Checksum (CRC) and Ram Static Test (RST) methods. Used for storage of T225 process workspaces and data.

preliminary_test_data.environmental_conditions: High Earth Orbit, exposure to proton radiation belts and solar events

seeData.environmental_conditions: High Earth Orbit, exposure to proton radiation belts and solar events
seeData.special_notes: Significant SEU rate increase observed during solar events, particularly severe during the November 2001 event.

pass_3.paper_name: SEE in-flight data for two static 32KB memories on high earth orbit
pass_3.objective: The main objective of the paper is to present the detailed analysis of in-flight data obtained for two 32KB SRAMs in the MPTB orbit over a 4-year period, focusing on the performance, reliability, and survivability of these devices in the space radiation environment.

parts.other_details: Entirely tested using Ram Static Test method. Observed for Single Event Upset (SEU) and stuck bits during solar events.

preliminary_test_data.environmental_conditions: High energy protons and heavy ions from Galactic Cosmic Rays and Solar Event Protons at high latitude and altitude

seeData.environmental_conditions: High energy protons and heavy ions from Galactic Cosmic Rays and Solar Event Protons at high latitude and altitude
seeData.special_notes: The SEU rate is correlated to high energy proton flux but the amplitude is not conserved.

parts.other_details: Partly tested using Cyclic Redundancy Checksum and Ram Static Test methods. Used for storage of T225 process workspaces and data.

preliminary_test_data.environmental_conditions: High energy protons and heavy ions from Galactic Cosmic Rays and Solar Event Protons at high latitude and altitude

seeData.environmental_conditions: High energy protons and heavy ions from Galactic Cosmic Rays and Solar Event Protons at high latitude and altitude
seeData.special_notes: The SEU rate is correlated to high energy proton flux but the amplitude is not conserved.

pass_1.paper_name: Single-Event Effects Measurements on COTS Electronic Devices for Use on NASA Mars Missions
pass_1.objective: The main objective of the paper is to report recent single-event effects measurements results for a variety of microelectronic devices to evaluate these devices for possible use in NASA Mars missions.

parts.other_details: Dual-bit dual-supply bus transceiver with configurable voltage translation

preliminary_test_data.environmental_conditions: Tests were done in air with normal incident beam at room temperature (~25°C) and elevated temperature (~70°C).

seeData.environmental_conditions: Two devices were tested at room temperature and at 70°C. The VCCA and VCCB power rails were set to 3.3 V during the SEL test, while a 3.3 V signal was connected to pin B1.
seeData.special_notes: No SELs were observed at an LET of 61.6 MeV-cm2/mg after a fluence of 1×107 124Xe ions/cm2. No SETs were observed.

parts.other_details: Level-shifting I2C bus repeater

preliminary_test_data.environmental_conditions: Tests were done in air with normal incident beam at room temperature (~25°C) and elevated temperature (~70°C).

seeData.environmental_conditions: Two devices were tested at room temperature and at 70°C. The VCCA and VCCB power rails were set to 3.3 and 5 V respectively during the SEL test, while a 3.3 V signal was connected to pin SCLA.
seeData.special_notes: No SELs were observed at an LET of 61.6 MeV-cm2/mg after a fluence of 1×107 124Xe ions/cm2. Small amount of SETs were observed with SCLA set to 0 V, capturing 37 positive SET events at an LET of 61.6 MeV-cm2/mg.

parts.other_details: Dual bus buffer with 3-state output

preliminary_test_data.environmental_conditions: Two devices were tested at room temperature and at 70°C. The VCC power rail and A1 input supply were set to 3.3 V during SEE testing.

seeData.environmental_conditions: Two devices were tested at room temperature and at 70°C. The VCC power rail and A1 input supply were set to 3.3 V during SEE testing.
seeData.special_notes: No SELs or SETs were observed at an LET of 61.6 MeV-cm2/mg after a fluence of 1×107 ions/cm2.

parts.other_details: 3 to 17 V, 3A step-down converter

preliminary_test_data.environmental_conditions: Two devices were tested at room and at 70°C. During the heavy ion measurements, the operating input voltage was set to 5 and 7.5V, while the output load condition was varied between no load and 500 mA.

seeData.environmental_conditions: Two devices were tested at room and at 70°C. The operating input voltage was set to 5 and 7.5V, while the output load condition was varied between no load and 500 mA.
seeData.special_notes: No SELs or destructive SEE were observed at an LET of 61.6 MeV-cm2/mg after a fluence of 1×107 ions/cm2. Minor negative and positive SETs were observed in the loaded condition.

parts.other_details: Logic controlled, high-side power switch with reverse current blocking

preliminary_test_data.environmental_conditions: The device was tested in no load and 200 mA load conditions for all SEE. Two devices were tested at room and at 70°C. During heavy ion measurements the operating input voltage was set to 3.3 V, while the output load condition was varied between no load and 200 mA.

seeData.environmental_conditions: The device was tested in no load and 200 mA load conditions for all SEE. Two devices were tested at room and at 70°C. During heavy ion measurements the operating input voltage was set to 3.3 V, while the output load condition was varied between no load and 200 mA.
seeData.special_notes: No SELs were observed at a LET of 61.6 MeV-cm2/mg at room temperature after a fluence of 1×107 ions/cm2. Handful of SELs were observed at both 61.6 and 47 MeV-cm2/mg at elevated temperature only. Five recoverable SEFIs were observed with the 200-mA load condition at an LET of 61.6 MeV-cm2/mg after a fluence of 3×107 ions/cm2 at room temperature.

parts.other_details: 18 V, 5 A eFuse power mux with multiple protection modes

preliminary_test_data.environmental_conditions: Two devices were tested at room and at 70°C. During the heavy ion measurements, the operating input voltage was set to 5 V, while the output load was varied between no load and 500 mA.

seeData.environmental_conditions: Two devices were tested at room and at 70 °C. During the heavy ion measurements, the operating input voltage was set to 5 V, while the output load was varied between no load and 500 mA.
seeData.special_notes: No SELs or Destructive Single-Event Effect (DSEE) were observed at an LET of 61.6 MeV-cm2/mg after a fluence of 1×107 ions/cm2. Self-recovering SEFIs and SETs were observed at LETs of 61.6 and 20.3 MeV-cm2/mg with the 500-mA load condition. Both SEEs did not have an impact on the 5 V output. They simply triggered a fault condition in the device. We observed 208 events after a fluence of 1.4×107 ions/cm2; majority of them were tiny negative going transients with an amplitude of less than 500 mV and a pulse width of 500 µs. Only handful of them were self-recovering SEFIs that resulted in a drop and self-recovery of the output fault signal of the device.

parts.other_details: 950MHz RF front end

preliminary_test_data.environmental_conditions: Two devices were tested at room and at 70°C. The VDD supply rails were powered by a single 3.3 V supply during the SEE test. No SELs were observed at an LET of 47 MeV-cm2/mg after a fluence of 1×107 ions/cm2. SEFIs were observed at LETs as low as 20Ne.

seeData.environmental_conditions: The plastic packages of the components were top-side delidded in order for the ions to have enough range to penetrate the sensitive region of the DUT. The LaunchXL-CC13-90US evaluation board was used to monitor device functionality, while a single 3.3 V supply provided power to the VDD rails. The DUT board was configured as a receiver, while a second control board was used to transmit wireless data.
seeData.special_notes: No SELs were observed at an LET of 47 MeV-cm2/mg after a fluence of 1×107 ions/cm2. During our measurements, we observed some SEFIs that resulted in test application hangs but were recoverable with a reset. These SEFIs were observed at LETs as low as 20Ne.

parts.other_details: Low-power, high-performance RF transceiver with analog features

preliminary_test_data.environmental_conditions: Two devices were tested at room and at 70°C. The VDD rails were powered by a single 3.3 V supply. SELs were observed at LETs as low as 20Ne.

seeData.environmental_conditions: The plastic packages of the components were top-side delidded to expose the die. A mbed NXP LPC1768 microcontroller, running custom test application, was used to interface with the CC1200EMK-420-470 evaluation module over SPI. Two devices were tested at room and at 70°C. The VDD rails were powered by a single 3.3 V supply.
seeData.special_notes: SELs were observed at LETs as low as 20Ne. For some of the runs, we removed the VDD supply current clamp, induced a latch-up, which resulted in a current increase of up to 220 mA, paused the beam while in the high-current state, and power cycled the DUT after several minutes. The components were still functional with nominal supply current after performing these measurements.

parts.other_details: RF Range Extender

preliminary_test_data.environmental_conditions: Two devices were tested at room and at 70°C. The LaunchXL-CC13-90US evaluation board was used to monitor device functionality, while a single 3.3 V supply provided power to the VDDS rails. The DUT board was configured as a receiver, while a second control board was used to transmit wireless data.

seeData.environmental_conditions: The plastic packages of the components were top-side delidded to expose the die. The LaunchXL-CC13-90US evaluation board was used to monitor device functionality, while a single 3.3 V supply provided power to the VDDS rails. The DUT board was configured as a receiver, while a second control board was used to transmit wireless data.
seeData.special_notes: No SELs were observed at an LET of 47 MeV-cm2/mg after a fluence of 1×107 ions/cm2. Similar to CC1190, we observed some SEFIs which were recoverable with a reset. These SEFIs were observed at LETs as low as 40Ar.

parts.other_details: 3.4 to 42 V, 6A synchronous step-down regulator

preliminary_test_data.environmental_conditions: The DUT plastic package was top-side delidded to expose the die. The DC2132A evaluation board from Texas Instruments was used to power the device and monitor the output voltage. For both DSEE and SET/SEFI tests, the PVIN rail was powered at 5 V, with no load and 200 mA load conditions. The device was also tested at 7.5 V PVIN for DSEE. Two devices were tested at room and at 70 °C.

seeData.environmental_conditions: The DUT plastic package was top-side delidded to expose the die. The DC2132A evaluation board from Texas Instruments was used to power the device and monitor the output voltage. For both DSEE and SET/SEFI tests, the PVIN rail was powered at 5 V, with no load and 200 mA load conditions. The device was also tested at 7.5 V PVIN for DSEE. Two devices were tested at room and at 70 °C.
seeData.special_notes: No SELs or DSEE were observed at an LET of 61.6 MeV-cm2/mg after a fluence of 1×107 ions/cm2. Small amount of self-recovery SEFIs in the form of output drop-outs were observed at 61.6 and 47 MeV-cm2/mg. The drop-outs were observed only in the loaded test condition. No SEFIs were observed at 20.3 MeV-cm2/mg.

pass_1.paper_name: Review of TID Effects Reported in ProASIC3 and ProASIC3L FPGAs for 3D PLUS Camera Heads
pass_1.objective: The main objective of the paper is to compare original TID data from ProASIC3L FPGAs with existing literature, discuss the impact of different test flows on the TID response, and correlate the data with TID tests of 3D PLUS camera heads.

parts.other_details: This device is part of the ProASIC3L family, which is a flash-based FPGA used in space applications. It was tested in a 3D PLUS space camera head module under various radiation conditions【8:0†source】.

preliminary_test_data.environmental_conditions: The irradiation was performed at a dose rate of 300 rad/h using 60Co. The camera sample was biased at the maximum recommended operating voltage of 9V; however, due to the design of the system, the FPGA received only a nominal bias of 3.3V, 2.5V and 1.5V on its power rails. During irradiation, the system was static: no clock was applied and no I/O operations were performed.

tidData.environmental_conditions: The irradiation was performed at a dose rate of 300 rad/h using 60Co. The camera sample was biased at the maximum recommended operating voltage of 9V; however, due to the design of the system, the FPGA received only a nominal bias of 3.3V, 2.5V and 1.5V on its power rails. During irradiation, the system was static: no clock was applied and no I/O operations were performed.
tidData.power_usage_description: Standby power consumption decreased by over 85% at 60 krad.
tidData.special_notes: The DUT was damaged by operator mishandling after the A1 characterization step and before the A2 annealing step, preventing further electro-optical tests.

preliminary_test_data.environmental_conditions: Samples were irradiated at dose rates of either 150,000 rad/h, 111,000 rad/h, or 36 rad/h at room temperature and under 1.5V core bias.

tidData.environmental_conditions: The irradiation was performed at a dose rate of 300 rad/h using 60Co. The camera sample was biased at the maximum recommended operating voltage of 9V; however, due to the design of the system, the FPGA received only a nominal bias of 3.3V, 2.5V and 1.5V on its power rails. During irradiation, the system was static: no clock was applied and no I/O operations were performed.
tidData.power_usage_description: Standby power consumption decreased by over 85% at 60 krad.
tidData.special_notes: The DUT was damaged by operator mishandling after the A1 characterization step and before the A2 annealing step, preventing further electro-optical tests.

pass_2.objective: The main objective of the paper is to compare original TID data from ProASIC3L FPGAs with existing literature, discuss the impact of different test flows on the TID response, and correlate the data with TID tests of 3D PLUS camera heads.

parts.other_details: Flash-based FPGA used in 3D PLUS space camera head module, tested for TID effects with a nominal bias of 3.3V, 2.5V, and 1.5V on its power rails【8:0†source】.

preliminary_test_data.environmental_conditions: The irradiation was performed at a dose rate of 300 rad/h using 60Co. The camera sample was biased at the maximum recommended operating voltage of 9V; however, due to the design of the system, the FPGA received only a nominal bias of 3.3V, 2.5V, and 1.5V on its power rails. During irradiation, the system was static: no clock was applied and no I/O operations were performed.

tidData.environmental_conditions: The irradiation was performed at a dose rate of 300 rad/h using 60Co. The camera sample was biased at the maximum recommended operating voltage of 9V; however, due to the design of the system, the FPGA received only a nominal bias of 3.3V, 2.5V, and 1.5V on its power rails. During irradiation, the system was static: no clock was applied and no I/O operations were performed.
tidData.power_usage_description: Standby power consumption decreased by over 85% at 60 krad.
tidData.special_notes: The DUT was damaged by operator mishandling after the A1 characterization step and before the A2 annealing step, preventing further electro-optical tests.

preliminary_test_data.environmental_conditions: The dose rate was 205 rad/h. All biases were static; no clocks were applied to the devices during irradiation.

tidData.environmental_conditions: The irradiation was performed at a dose rate of 300 rad/h using 60Co. The camera sample was biased at the maximum recommended operating voltage of 9V; however, due to the design of the system, the FPGA received only a nominal bias of 3.3V, 2.5V, and 1.5V on its power rails. During irradiation, the system was static: no clock was applied and no I/O operations were performed.
tidData.power_usage_description: Standby power consumption decreased by over 85% at 60 krad.
tidData.special_notes: The DUT was damaged by operator mishandling after the A1 characterization step and before the A2 annealing step, preventing further electro-optical tests.

pass_3.paper_name: Review of TID Effects Reported in ProASIC3 and ProASIC3L FPGAs for 3D PLUS Camera Heads
pass_3.objective: This paper compares original TID data from ProASIC3L FPGAs with existing literature, discusses the impact of different test flows on the TID response, and correlates the data with TID tests of 3D PLUS camera heads.

parts.other_details: Flash-based FPGA used in 3D PLUS space camera head module, evaluated for TID effects.

preliminary_test_data.environmental_conditions: Irradiation performed at a dose rate of 300 rad/h using 60Co, with the system static and no clock or I/O operations performed.

tidData.environmental_conditions: Irradiation performed at a dose rate of 300 rad/h using 60Co, with the system static and no clock or I/O operations performed.
tidData.power_usage_description: Standby power consumption decreased by over 85% at 60 krad.
tidData.special_notes: Functional recovery observed after annealing at 100°C for 168 hours.
